Decided the following:
### Article One:
Kamco Investment Company <orig>شركة كامكو للاستثمار</orig> is licensed to privately market 50,000,000 units (fifty million units only) of the Kamco Pre-IPO Tech Fund LP <orig>صندوق كامكو للتكنولوجيا قبل الطرح العام الأولي ال بي</orig> units within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, which is established in the United Arab Emirates <orig>دولة الإمارات العربية المتحدة</orig>. The offer price shall be 1 US Dollar (one US Dollar only) per unit, in addition to subscription fees not exceeding 2% of the capital invested by the investor.

### Article Two:
The units to be marketed within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> shall be offered exclusively to professional clients as stipulated in Book One (Definitions) <orig>الكتاب الأول (التعريفات)</orig> of the Executive Regulations of Law No. 7 of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities and their Amendments. The entity receiving subscription requests shall be:
- Kamco Investment Company <orig>شركة كامكو للاستثمار</orig>.

### Article Three:
The objectives of the collective investment scheme shall be determined based on what is stated in the prospectus.

### Article Four:
The marketing license duration is one year, starting from the date of issuance of the Authority's <orig>الهيئة</orig> license certificate and after payment of the prescribed fees.

### Article Five:
The prescribed fees shall be paid within one month from the date of issuance of this decision. In case of failure to pay the fees within the specified period, the decision shall be considered null and void.

### Article Six:
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction, and it shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

## Decision No. (122) of 2025
Regarding the Renewal of Securities Activities License for HSBC Bank Middle East Limited <orig>بنك اتش اس بي سي الشرق الأوسط المحدود</orig>

Having reviewed:
-Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, its Executive Regulations, and their Amendments;
-And the Securities Activities License Certificate for HSBC Bank Middle East Limited <orig>بنك اتش اس بي سي الشرق الأوسط المحدود</orig> No. (AP/2022/0004) issued on 20/09/2022;
-And the request from HSBC Bank Middle East Limited <orig>بنك اتش اس بي سي الشرق الأوسط المحدود</orig> to renew its securities activities license with the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>;
-And based on Decision No. (4) of 2025 regarding the Amendment of Final Approval Powers for the Supervision Sector's Work Procedures, issued on 12/01/2025.

### Article One:

# Decision No. (124) of 2025
Regarding a Private Marketing License for a Collective Investment Scheme Established Outside the State of Kuwait, Granted to Bayt Al-Tamweel Capital Investment Company <orig>بيتك كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> for Marketing Units of Bayt Al-Tamweel Capital US Real Estate Fund 9 <orig>صندوق بيتك كابيتال العقاري الأمريكي 9</orig>

Having reviewed:
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, its Executive Regulations, and their amendments;
- The Articles of Association and Memorandum of Incorporation of Bayt Al-Tamweel Capital Investment Company <orig>بيتك كابيتال للاستثمار</orig>;
- And the agreement concluded between the representative of the collective investment scheme, KFHCI Investment Advisory 9 Limited <orig>كي اف اتش سي انفستمنت أد فايزوري 9 ليمتد</orig>, and the Marketing Manager, Bayt Al-Tamweel Capital Investment Company <orig>بيتك كابيتال للاستثمار</orig>;
- And the request from Bayt Al-Tamweel Capital Investment Company <orig>بيتك كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> to undertake the private marketing of units of Bayt Al-Tamweel Capital US Real Estate Fund 9 <orig>صندوق بيتك كابيتال العقاري الأمريكي 9</orig>;
- And based on Decision No. (04) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval powers for the work procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/01/2025.

It was decided as follows:
## Article One
Bayt Al-Tamweel Capital Investment Company <orig>بيتك كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> is licensed to privately market 250,000 units (only two hundred and fifty thousand units) of Bayt Al-Tamweel Capital US Real Estate Fund 9 <orig>صندوق بيتك كابيتال العقاري الأمريكي 9</orig> (KFHC U.S. REAL ESTATE FUND IX) within the State of Kuwait, which is established in the Cayman Islands. The offering price per unit at the time of subscription/purchase shall be determined based on the net asset value, in addition to a one-time subscription fee of 2% of the purchase price of each investment unit.

## Article Two
The units to be marketed within the State of Kuwait shall be offered to professional clients only, as per the text in Book One (Definitions) of the Executive Regulations of Law No. 7 of 2010 regarding the Establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the Regulation of Securities Activities, its Executive Regulations, and their amendments. The entities that receive subscription requests are:
- Bayt Al-Tamweel Capital Investment Company <orig>بيتك كابيتال للاستثمار</orig>.
- Kuwait Finance House <orig>بيت التمويل الكويتي</orig>.

## Article Three
The objectives of the collective investment scheme shall be determined based on what is stated in the offering prospectus.

## Article Four
The marketing license duration is one year, starting from the date of issuance of the Authority's license certificate and after payment of the prescribed fees.

## Article Five
The prescribed fees shall be paid within one month from the date of issuance of this decision. In case of failure to pay the fees within the specified period, the decision shall be considered null and void.

## Article Six
The competent authorities shall implement this decision, each within its jurisdiction, and it shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

Head of Supervision Sector
Ziad Yaqoub Yousef Al-Fulaij <orig>زياد يعقوب يوسف الفليج</orig>
Issued on: 8 July 2025 AD

# Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>
## Correction
A material error occurred in Ministerial Decision No. (55) of 2025 issuing the Executive Regulations of the Law on Tax on Multinational Entity Groups <orig>مجموعة الكيانات متعددة الجنسيات</orig>, promulgated by Decree-Law No. 157 of 2024, published in the supplement to Issue No. 1745, dated 30/6/2025. The error occurred in Article 115.

The error is:
The following provisions shall apply to determine the tax base for Pillar Two purposes for acquired assets transferred between participating entities after 30 November 2021:
1- Increase the book value of transferred assets that are transferred by capital expenditures or reduced by depreciation or amortization that arise after the transaction and before the start of the transition period, in accordance with the
2- consolidated accounting standard in the financial statements used for the purposes of determining Pillar Two income or loss.
3- Exclude any increase in depreciation or amortization attributable to recording assets at fair value in the financial accounting of the acquiring entity from the calculation of Pillar Two income or loss.
4- If the acquiring participating entity records the acquired asset at fair value in its financial accounts, it may instead use the book value of that asset as stated in its financial accounts in all subsequent periods if it would otherwise be entitled to consider a deferred tax asset equal to the minimum tax multiplied by the difference between the local tax base of the asset and the Pillar Two book value of the asset determined under this Article.

The correct text is:
The following provisions shall apply to determine the tax base for Pillar Two purposes for acquired assets transferred between participating entities after 30 November 2021:
1- Increase the book value of transferred assets that are transferred by capital expenditures or reduced by depreciation or amortization that arise after the transaction and before the start of the transition period, in accordance with the accounting standard in the financial statements used for the purposes of determining Pillar Two income or loss.
2- Exclude any increase in depreciation or amortization attributable to recording assets at fair value in the financial accounting of the acquiring entity from the calculation of Pillar Two income or loss.

The Public Prosecution <orig>البياعة العامة</orig> hereby announces the convicted person <orig>المحكوم عليه</orig> by this judgment and instructs all security authorities <orig>جهات الأمن</orig> to implement it in accordance with the text of Article 188 of the Code of Criminal Procedure and Trials <orig>قانون الإجراءات والمحاكمات الجزائية</orig>, noting that if a period of thirty-seven days, calculated from the second day of publication, passes without the convicted person appealing by objection or appeal, the judgment becomes final and enforceable against them.
Director of Criminal Enforcement Prosecution <orig>مدير نيابة التنفيذ الجنائي</orig>

# Petrochemical Industries Company <orig>شركة صناعة الكيماويات البترولية</orig>
## Announcement

The Higher Purchasing Committee for Tenders of Kuwait Petroleum Corporation <orig>مؤسسة البترول الكويتية</orig> and its oil companies (H.P.C), upon the request of Petrochemical Industries Company <orig>شركة صناعة الكيماويات البترولية</orig> (PIC) – Internal Purchasing Committee (I.P.C), announces the issuance of Tender No.: MNA/07/2025 regarding Internet Services Renewal.

<table_caption>Tender Details for Internet Services Renewal</table_caption>
<table>
| Issue Date | Closing Date | Document Value | Initial Guarantee |
|:---|:---|:---|:---|
| 2025/07/13  | 2025/08/12   | KD 100      | KD 2,500/-     |
</table>

*   This tender is limited and non-divisible among the companies listed in the table below.

### Scope of Tender Works:

Provide internet services, MPLS services, Security DDOS service, DWDM service and home internet (GPON and 5G)

*   The tender closing time is 1:00 PM on Tuesday, 12/08/2025. Bids must be submitted to the electronic platform (K-Tendering). No copy of the bid shall be sent to any other party except the mentioned email; otherwise, the bid will be considered void. The bid validity period shall be (90) days from the date of opening the bids. No bids will be accepted after the specified date.
*   The preliminary meeting will be held at 10:00 AM on Monday, 28/07/2025, noting that the meeting will be held virtually (Virtual Meeting).
*   An initial guarantee in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee from a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of Petrochemical Industries Company <orig>شركة صناعة الكيماويات البترولية</orig>, for the amount of (2,500/-) Two Thousand Five Hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, for the same validity period as the bid, must be submitted. The original guarantee must be submitted sufficiently before the closing date, provided that a soft copy is attached with the bid.
*   The original initial bank guarantee, whose value is specified in this announcement, must be delivered to the Sub-Committee for Opening Bids before the specified tender closing date, at the company's main headquarters in South Sabahiya <orig>جنوب الصباحية</orig>, Office No. (112-CG), with a soft copy required to be attached with the bid.
*   The last date for submitting any inquiries, reservations, or requests by participating companies regarding this tender is 30/07/2025. These requests will not be considered for any reason after this specified date.
*   The document purchase value is (100/-) One Hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
*   Documents can be purchased by bank deposit into the account of Petrochemical Industries Company <orig>شركة صناعة الكيماويات البترولية</orig>, with the tender number and the name of the purchasing company clearly added to the bank purchase receipt, according to the following details:
    *   Account Name : Petrochemical Industries
    *   Company
    *   Banker's Name : National Bank of Kuwait,
    *   Ahmadi Branch , Kuwait
    *   IBAN # KW77NBOK000000000001003811717
    *   KD Call Account No. : 1003811717
    *   Swift Code : NBOKKWKW

### To be submitted with the bid:

1.  A copy of the initial guarantee (certified check / or letter of guarantee) from a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of Petrochemical Industries Company <orig>شركة صناعة الكيماويات البترولية</orig>.
2.  A copy of the signature authorization (letter of authorization for authorized signatories).
3.  A 'To Whom It May Concern' certificate issued by the Public Authority for Civil Information <orig>الهيئة العامة للمعلومات المدنية</orig>.
4.  A certificate of compliance with national labor percentage issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> – National Labor Development Department – valid for one year.
5.  A certificate of payment of subscriptions to the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسة العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig> as stipulated in Article (95) of the Social Security Law.
6.  A clearance certificate for the contractor's contribution payment to the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig> as stated in item (Fourth) of the letter from the Head of the Cabinet Diwan <orig>ديوان مجلس الوزراء</orig> dated 26/01/2022.
7.  A copy of the company's articles of association and commercial license from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> and any subsequent amendments thereto.
8.  A copy of the registration receipt with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات</orig> and a copy of the registration certificate with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.
9.  A certificate from the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> stating that there are no income tax reservations on the company, and a list of international agencies represented by the company with supporting evidence.
10. Companies classified as small or medium enterprises wishing to participate in the tender must submit a valid registration certificate in the National Register for the Care and Development of Small and Medium Enterprises.

*   Any changes will be announced through Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> newspaper and/or the company's website (www.pic.com.kw).
*   For inquiries regarding the tender, please contact the Contracts Team via email at contracts_team@pic.com.kw or by phone at: 23851368.

# Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>

Announcement
Regarding the Issuance of Practice No. (2025/6-2026)

The Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> announces the issuance of Practice No. (2025/6-2026) for the benefit of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, in accordance with the general and special terms and specifications contained in the lists and schedules of the practice documents available at the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, which can be obtained from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> - Financial Affairs Department <orig>إدارة الشئون المالية</orig> - Purchases and Stores Control <orig>مراقبة المشتريات والمخازن</orig> - Tenders and Contracts Section <orig>قسم المناقصات والعقود</orig> - Ministries Complex <orig>مجمع الوزارات</orig> Block No. (1), Third Floor, Room No. (1307). A non-refundable fee of (75 K.D.) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig> per copy is required, payable via K-NET, during official working hours, starting from noon on Sunday, 13/7/2025. The deadline for submitting bids is 12:00 PM on Monday, 28/7/2025. Bids shall be submitted to the Purchases and Stores Control <orig>مراقبة المشتريات والمخازن</orig>. These bids shall be valid for ninety days from the date of opening the envelopes, provided that the submitted price is eight.
The value of the preliminary guarantee for this bid shall not be less than (2%) of the bid value and must be valid throughout the bid's validity period.

Undersecretary of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>

Dar Al-Khubara Real Estate Company <orig>شركة دار الخبراء العقارية</orig> (K.S.C.C.) (Closed)
Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
The Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting of Dar Al-Khubara Real Estate Company <orig>شركة دار الخبراء العقارية</orig> (K.S.C.C.) (Closed) (under liquidation) was held at the company's headquarters located in Hawally <orig>حولي</orig> area - Street 114 - Plot 17 - First Floor - on Monday, 2/6/2025, at 12:00 PM.
with the presence of shareholders representing 100% of the capital, totaling 20,000,000 shares.
This includes 75,000 shares in person and 19,925,000 shares by proxy.
The Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> was notified of the date of the company's Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting, and the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> responded that the matter had been noted.
In the presence of Mr. Nasser Abdullah Yousef Al-Qatami <orig>ناصر عبد الله يوسف القطامي</orig>, authorized by all shareholders.
In the presence of Mr. Musa Ibrahim Hassan Saad <orig>موسى إبراهيم حسن سعد</orig> from Dar Al-Taqaddum Audit Office <orig>مكتب دار التقدم لتدقيق الحسابات</orig>.

# Al-Nadi Holding Company <orig>شركة النادي القابضة</orig> (K.S.C.C.) (Closed)
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

On Sunday, June 22, 2025, at 11:00 AM, the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting of Al-Nadi Holding Company <orig>شركة النادي القابضة</orig> (K.S.C.C.) (Closed) was held at the headquarters of Al-Nadi Holding Company <orig>شركة النادي القابضة</orig>, chaired by Mr. Nawaf Abdullah Al-Rifai <orig>نواف عبدالله الرفاعي</orig> - Chairman of the Board of Directors.

The Chairman of the Board of Directors opened the session and announced the availability of the quorum for the meeting. The total shares present were 212,742,727 shares, representing 88.19% of the company's total shares of 241,237,328 shares. The agenda items were discussed, and the Extraordinary General Assembly decided the following:

### Item One:
- Approval was given to increase the company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital from K.D. 26,804,235.100 (Twenty-six million, eight hundred and four thousand, two hundred and thirty-five Kuwaiti Dinars and one hundred fils) to K.D. 30,000,000 (Thirty million Kuwaiti Dinars), an increase of K.D. 3,195,764.900 (Three million, one hundred and ninety-five thousand, seven hundred and sixty-four Kuwaiti Dinars and nine hundred fils), distributed over 31,957,649 shares (Thirty-one million, nine hundred and fifty-seven thousand, six hundred and forty-nine shares) at a value of 100 fils per share, plus an issue premium of 20 fils per share. This increase shall be paid in cash to the current shareholders registered in the company's records on the date of the General Assembly, each according to their ownership percentage of the company's total share capital.
- Determine the subscription period as (15) days starting from the date of opening the subscription.
- Any current shareholder may waive their right of priority subscription to the capital increase shares, wholly or partially, in favor of another shareholder by means of a written letter submitted to the Board of Directors during the subscription period.
- In the event that current shareholders do not subscribe to all offered shares (according to their ownership percentage of the total share capital) within the specified legal period, the subscription will be opened to shareholders to subscribe to the unsubscribed shares, each according to their ownership percentage of the total unsubscribed shares, and then it will be opened to third parties (non-shareholders) to cover the remaining shares.
- The Board of Directors is authorized to set the controls, terms, and conditions for calling up the value and amount of capital increase installments and their call dates, and to dispose of fractional shares, if any, as well as to take all necessary measures to implement the increase resolution, including opening the subscription, determining the period, amending the Articles of Association and the Memorandum of Incorporation, and carrying out procedures before the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> and the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> if required.

### Item Two:
- Approval was given to amend Article No. (6) of the Articles of Association and Article No. (5) of the Memorandum of Incorporation according to the following statement:

**Text Before Amendment:**
The company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital was set at K.D. 26,804,235.100 (Twenty-six million, eight hundred and four thousand, two hundred and thirty-five Kuwaiti Dinars and one hundred fils), distributed over 268,042,351 shares (Only two hundred and sixty-eight million, forty-two thousand, three hundred and fifty-one shares) with a value of 100 fils per share, and all shares are cash shares.

**Text After Amendment:**
The company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital was set at K.D. 30,000,000 (Thirty million Kuwaiti Dinars), distributed over 300,000,000 shares (Three hundred million shares) with a value of 100 fils per share, and all shares are cash shares. The company's paid-up capital was set at K.D. 26,804,235.100 (Twenty-six million, eight hundred and four thousand, two hundred and thirty-five Kuwaiti Dinars and one hundred fils), distributed over 268,042,351 shares (Only two hundred and sixty-eight million, forty-two thousand, three hundred and fifty-one shares) with a value of 100 fils per share, and all shares are cash shares. The Extraordinary General Assembly meeting concluded at 12:00 PM.
Chairman of the Board of Directors

# International Aviation Technical Group for Aircraft Fuel Supply Company <orig>شركة انترناشيونال أفييشن تكنيكال جروب لتزويد وقود الطائرات</orig>
## Kuwaiti Shareholding Company (Closed)
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
### Held on 2/7/2025

The Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of International Aviation Technical Group for Aircraft Fuel Supply Company <orig>شركة انترناشيونال أفييشن تكنيكال جروب لتزويد وقود الطائرات</orig> - a Kuwaiti Shareholding Company (Closed) - held its meeting at 10:30 AM on Wednesday, 2/7/2025 AD, in Shuwaikh <orig>الشويخ</orig> - Free Trade Zone - E65 - First Floor.

The meeting was held under the chairmanship of Mr. Qutaiba Abdullah Al-Rahmani <orig>قتيبة عبدالله الرحماني</orig> - Chairman of the Board of Directors, and in the presence of:
- Mr. Fahad Abdul Rahman Al-Badiwi <orig>فهد عبد الرحمن البديوي</orig> - representing Gulf Custody Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig> - attended the meeting via Zoom application.
- Mr. Mohammed Adnan Ayish <orig>محمد عدنان عايش</orig> - Board Secretary.
- Mr. Ali Mohammed Sayed <orig>علي محمد سيد</orig> - Company Financial Manager.
- Shareholders holding 250,000 shares in person and 9,250,000,9 shares by proxy, representing 95.0000% of the total share capital of 10,000,000 shares.

After the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting was announced, Mr. Qutaiba Abdullah Al-Rahmani <orig>قتيبة عبدالله الرحماني</orig> opened the meeting session, welcoming the attendees. He then proceeded to present the item on the agenda of the Extraordinary General Assembly, whereupon the Extraordinary General Assembly approved the following:

**First:** Amendment of the text of Article No. (5) of the Articles of Association and Article (4) of the Company's Memorandum of Incorporation:

**The purposes for which the company was established are to carry out the following:**

**Text of Article No. (5) Before Amendment:**
1. Purchase and sale of all types of aircraft fuel.
2. Purchase and sale of all types of aircraft oils.
3. Use of machinery and transportation means for transporting fuel to aircraft.

- This item was objected to and not approved by shareholders owning and representing 60,000,000 shares, equivalent to 40% of the company's total share capital.

### Mena Homes Real Estate Company (K.S.C.C.) <orig>شركة مينا هومز العقارية (ش.م.ك) مقفلة</orig>
#### Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
Held on Monday, 23/06/2025 AD
The Extraordinary General Assembly of Mena Homes Real Estate Company (K.S.C.C.) <orig>شركة مينا هومز العقارية (ش.م.ك.) مقفلة</orig> held its extraordinary meeting at 12:00 PM on Monday, 23/06/2025, in Sharq - Khalid Bin Al-Waleed Street - Kiko Tower – 24th Floor. The meeting was chaired by Mr. Mazen Essam Hawwa <orig>مازن عصام حوا</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors.
The following also attended the meeting:
- Mr. Ali Al-Hayat <orig>علي الحياة</orig> from the company's auditor's office (Ernst & Young) – Al-Aiban & Al-Osaimi & Partners <orig>مكتب العيبان والعصيمي وشركاهم</orig>.
- Mr. Abdo Salama Hassan Al-Dabaa <orig>عبده سلامة حسن الضبع</orig> (Secretary of the Assembly).
- Mr. Tariq Annabousi <orig>طارق عنبوسي</orig> – attending on behalf of Shareholder No. (00000809378) and owning 49,997 shares (United Tamleek Real Estate Services Company LLC <orig>شركة تمليك المتحدة للخدمات العقارية ذ.م.م.</orig>) (representing the minority percentage).
Shareholders owning (100%) of the company's shares by proxy attended the meeting. After announcing the availability of the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting for the attendees, the review and discussion of the items on the agenda then commenced, followed by the approval and ratification of the following agenda items:
First: Approval was granted to reduce the company's authorized and issued capital from KWD 100,000,000 (one hundred million Kuwaiti Dinars) to KWD 80,000,000 (eighty million Kuwaiti Dinars) only, with an uncalled amount of KWD 20,000,000 (twenty million Kuwaiti Dinars).
Second: Approval was granted to reduce the paid-up capital from KWD 80,000,000 (eighty million Kuwaiti Dinars only) to KWD 61,831,394 (sixty-one

### Manajer International Holding Company (K.S.C.C.) <orig>شركة مناجر العالمية القابضة (ش.م.ك) مقفلة</orig>
#### Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting Held on June 25, 2025 AD
The esteemed members of the company's Board of Directors held a meeting in the meeting room at the company's headquarters at 11:30 AM on Wednesday, June 25, 2025, with the attendance of:
1. Mr. Taher Arifi Taher Al-Shammari <orig>طاهر عريفي طاهر الشمري</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors.
2. Mr. Abdullah Arifi Taher Wawan <orig>عبدالله عريفي طاهر واوان</orig>, Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors.
3. Mr. Abdulaziz Arifi Taher Al-Shammari <orig>عبدالعزيز عريفي طاهر الشمري</orig>, Board Member.
4. Mr. Fahad Abdulrahman Al-Badiwi <orig>فهد عبدالرحمن البديوي</orig> from Gulf Custody Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig>.
Mr. Taher Arifi Al-Shammari <orig>طاهر عريفي الشمري</orig>, Chairman of the Board of Directors, opened the session by welcoming the attendees and proposed nominating Mr. Abdulaziz Arifi Taher Al-Shammari <orig>عبد العزيز عريفي طاهر الشمري</orig> to act as the Secretary of the meeting. The agenda was then discussed as follows:
- The shareholders agreed to voluntarily dissolve and liquidate Manajer International Holding Company <orig>شركة مناجر العالمية القابضة</orig>.
- It was agreed to appoint Moore Global Audit Office <orig>مكتب مور العالمية لتدقيق الحسابات</orig> – Mr. Hosni Ahmed Alian <orig>حسني أحمد عليان</orig> – Civil ID No. 270120109051 as liquidator for the company for a period of one year.
- The office fees were set at KWD 2,500 (two thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars only).
The Board of Directors meeting concluded at 11:40 AM.
Chairman of the Board of Directors

## Ministry of Foreign Affairs / Wizarat Al-Kharijiya <orig>وزارة الخارجية</orig>
### Announcement
Public Tender No.: M.F.A. / 4-2026-2025 regarding the provision of internet service and connection of the general network for the Ministry's General Diwan headquarters and its facilities.
The Ministry of Foreign Affairs / Wizarat Al-Kharijiya <orig>وزارة الخارجية</orig> announces its need to issue Tender No.: M.F.A. / 4-2026-2025 regarding the provision of internet service and connection of the general network for the Ministry's General Diwan headquarters and its facilities, according to the general and special conditions and technical specifications outlined in the tender documents. Specialized companies wishing to participate in the tender are kindly requested to visit the Procurement and Institute Control / Muraqabat Al-Mushtariyat wal-Ma'had <orig>مراقبة المشتريات والمعهد</orig> at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs building - Arabian Gulf Street / Shari' Al-Khaleej Al-Arabi <orig>شارع الخليج العربي</orig>, to obtain the tender documents during official working hours from (10:00 AM until 1:00 PM) for a non-refundable cash fee of (75 K.D.) only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. The tender documents can be purchased during the period from Sunday, 13/07/2025, until Thursday, 24/07/2025, with the submission of the following documents:
1- Authorization letter from the company to purchase the tender documents in the name of the person, and a copy of their Civil ID.
2- Payment of the prescribed fees for purchasing the tender documents via Knet.
3- Copy of the Commercial Register.
4- Copy of the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry certificate "recent".
5- Copy of the registration receipt with the Central Agency for Public Tenders "recent".
6- The company must be specialized in this field.
7- Annual employment percentage certificate.

Director General of the General Department of Kuwaiti Nationality and Travel Documents / Mudir Amm Al-Idara Al-Amma lil-Jinsiya wa Watha'iq Al-Safar Al-Kuwaitiya <orig>مدير عام الإدارة العامة للجنسية ووثائق السفر الكويتية</orig>
### Announcement
The General Department of Nationality and Travel Documents / Al-Idara Al-Amma lil-Jinsiya wa Watha'iq Al-Safar <orig>الإدارة العامة للجنسية ووثائق السفر</orig> announces that the individuals listed below claim to have lost their Kuwaiti passports. Anyone who finds any of them is requested to hand them over to the Department within two weeks from the date of publication of this announcement in the Official Gazette / Al-Jarida Al-Rasmiya <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>. Otherwise, these individuals will be granted new Kuwaiti passports according to the established procedures.

Companies wishing to participate in the practice must:

2. Submit a letter of authorization from the company to purchase the documents.
3. Submit a copy of the national labor support certificate for non-governmental companies (annual).
4. Submit an official letter for any inquiries within (one week) from the date of publication of the announcement.
5. For inquiries, call: 1844411 (ext. 61929)

The closing date (submission of bids) for the aforementioned practice has been extended to Wednesday, 30/07/2025, at the Tender Opening Committee of the Purchasing Committee in Sharq area – Al-Siddiq School <orig>مدرسة الصديق</orig> – First Floor, from (8:00) eight AM until (1:00) one PM. No bids submitted before or after the mentioned deadline will be accepted.
A preliminary meeting will be held on Wednesday, 07/09/2025, at the headquarters of the General Administration of Construction and Maintenance <orig>الإدارة العامة للإنشاءات والصيانة</orig> at (10:00) AM, noting that any recommendations or decisions resulting from this meeting are an integral part of the practice documents and are binding on all companies, whether the practitioner attended or did not attend the mandatory preliminary meeting.

Bids shall be placed in the bid box at the Medical Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig>, and bids must be valid for a period of (90 days) from the closing date.
Companies wishing to participate in the practice must meet the following conditions:
1- The local company must be registered with the Medical Warehouses Department <orig>إدارة المستودعات الطبية</orig> in the suppliers' register.

3- When submitting two offers, two booklets must be purchased with different receipts.

5- Provide samples of new materials, whether a new product requested for the first time or from a new manufacturer, for the specialized control (drugs – medical supplies).
6- Attach a certificate of national labor support percentage.
7- Practice documents can be obtained from the Ministry of Health's <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> official website.
8- The fees for purchasing the booklet can be paid through the website to be attached with the practice documents.
9- Submit price offers in a sealed envelope, including the practice documents, according to the closing date specified on the Ministry of Health's <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> official website.

Member of the Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig> meeting in its session
held on 22/06/2025, Committee <orig>لجنه</orig> 2025/17

The Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig>, stipulated in Article 15 of Law No. 36/69 and formed by Ministerial Resolution No. 1650/2021, met.
*   Mr. / Director of the Central Registry Department for Births and Deaths <orig>إدارة السجل المركزي للمواليد والوفيات</orig> - Chairman
*   Dr. / Head of the General Medical Council <orig>المجلس الطبي العام</orig> - Member
*   Mr. / Head of the Registration Section <orig>قسم القيد</orig> - Member
*   Mr. / Legal Researcher <orig>الباحث القانوني</orig> - Member
*   Mr. / Head of the Research and Opinion Section <orig>قسم البحوث والرأي</orig> - Member
*   Mr. / Head of the Deaths Section <orig>قسم الوفيات</orig> - Member
*   Mr. / Head of the Records Section <orig>قسم السجلات</orig> - Member

The secretariat of the committee was handled by Ms. Shukriya Al-Duraie <orig>شكرية الدريعي</orig>.
The committee reviewed requests from No. (216) to No. (234) in the attached list, pertaining to the amendment of data in birth and death records for dropped birth and death registrations.
The committee, after its review and ensuring the completeness of documents and records, decided to announce the amendments and requests in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) in two consecutive issues, so that if
the legal period (fifteen days) from the date of the last announcement expires and no one submits any objection during the said period, the amendments will be made in the registers and birth and death certificates will be issued.

# Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>
## Announcement
Practice Documents No. (MOJ/6-2025/2026) Supply, Installation, Inspection, Operation, and Maintenance of a Modern PABX System with all its Accessories at Al-Ahmadi <orig>الأحمدي</orig> Courts Complex Building at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>
The Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> announces to companies and institutions specialized in this field its need for the supply, installation, inspection, operation, and maintenance of a modern PABX system with all its accessories at Al-Ahmadi <orig>الأحمدي</orig> Courts Complex Building at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>, in accordance with the terms and specifications detailed in the practice documents, which can be obtained from the Tenders Department - located in the Ministries Complex, Block (14), Third Floor - at 8:00 AM on Sunday, 13/07/2025, during official working hours, starting from Sunday, 13/07/2025.

A non-refundable subscription fee of (75 K.D.) / seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً</orig> only is required. Offers must be submitted to the Ministry's Tenders Department, accompanied by an initial security deposit of (2%) of the total value of the offer, provided that this security remains valid throughout the offer's validity period of (90) days. The final deadline for submitting offers is 1:00 PM on Monday, 11/08/2025.
Please note that a preliminary meeting will be held at the Ministry's headquarters, in the Financial Affairs Department, located in the Ministries Complex, Third Floor, at 11:00 AM on Monday, 04/08/2025. Whether the practitioner attends this meeting or not, they will be bound by all decisions or recommendations resulting from the meeting, if any.
Director of Financial Affairs Department

applicable in the Emirate of Dubai <orig>إمارة دبي</orig> pursuant to an amendment to the Articles of Association issued under number: 2023/1/288382
dated 30/5/2023 and duly attested by all competent official authorities,

including an amendment to the Articles of Association for a One-Person Company issued
under number: 2024/1/1410611 dated 20/11/2024, and duly attested by
all competent official authorities, most recently the Ministry of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزارة الخارجية</orig> of Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig> on
9/12/2024.
Represented by Mr. Mohsen Zaid Faihan Al-Mutairi <orig>محسن زيد فيحان المطيري</orig> - Kuwaiti national - holding Civil ID No.:
268102001677 pursuant to a power of attorney issued by Dubai Courts <orig>محاكم دبي</orig> under number:
2024/1/1410878 dated 20/11/2024 and duly attested by all
competent official authorities, most recently the Ministry of Foreign Affairs <orig>وزارة الخارجية</orig> of Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig> on 9/12/2024.
They, being of full legal capacity, requested the notarization of the following contract:
Pursuant to Resolution No. (4) of (2025) issued by the Direct Investment Authority <orig>هيئة الاستثمار المباشر</orig> on (23/3/2025)
Company Name: Kuwait Festival City Company <orig>شركة كويت فيستيفال سيتي</orig>
Address: One-Person Company (OPC) <orig>ش.ش.و</orig> - For Profit
Company Capital: 10,000 (Ten Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only)
The founder agreed and affirmed the establishment of the One-Person Company in accordance with the provisions of
Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its executive regulations, and the provisions of Law No.
116 of 2013 <orig>القانون رقم 116 لسنة 2013</orig> concerning the encouragement of direct investment in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and its executive
regulations, and in accordance with the rules, controls, foundations, and standards issued by the Board of Directors of the
Direct Investment Promotion Authority <orig>هيئة تشجيع الاستثمار المباشر</orig>. The company shall acquire legal personality from the date of its registration
in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>. The company may not commence its activities until after its publication in the Official
Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>, obtaining licenses and approvals from regulatory bodies for carrying out the activity,
and their adherence to all established rules for company formation, in accordance with the provisions stipulated in
the following articles:

### Company Name
#### Article (1)
Company Name / Kuwait Festival City Company <orig>شركة كويت فيستيفال سيتي</orig> / One-Person Company (OPC) <orig>ش.ش.و</orig> - For Profit

### Company's Head Office
#### Article (2)
The company's head office and domicile is the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>. The capital owner may transfer it to any
other location within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, and may also establish branches and agencies for the company inside
and outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>. This head office is considered the legal domicile of the company, which is relied upon
for directing correspondence and judicial notices to the company. Its data shall be recorded in the Commercial
Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>, and any change to this domicile shall not be recognized until it is registered in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>.

### Company Duration
#### Article (3)
The duration of the company's contract is 99 years, commencing from the date of the company's contract publication. This
period may be extended before its expiry by a decision of the capital owner. If no decision for extension is issued
and the company continues to carry out its activities, the company's duration shall automatically be extended each time for a period
similar to that mentioned in the contract and under the same conditions.

Without prejudice to the provisions of Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> issuing the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> –
and its executive regulations, and the provisions of Law No. 116 of 2013 <orig>القانون رقم 116 لسنة 2013</orig> concerning the encouragement of
direct investment in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and its executive regulations, the purposes for which it was established are:

### Company Purpose
#### Article (4)
1- General construction of residential buildings
2- General construction of non-residential buildings
3- Project management
The company may engage in similar, complementary, necessary, or related activities to its stated purposes.
The company is prohibited from engaging in activities stipulated in Cabinet Resolution No. 75 of 2015 <orig>قرار مجلس الوزراء رقم 75 لسنة 2015</orig>
regarding the determination of a list of investments not subject to the provisions of Law No. 116 of 2013 <orig>القانون رقم 116 لسنة 2013</orig>.

### Company Capital
#### Article (5)
The company's capital is set at 10,000 (Ten Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only),
with a total of 100 cash shares, the value of each cash share being 100 (One Hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only), non-divisible.

The company's manager may not manage another competing company or a company with similar purposes, or contract with the company on his own behalf or on behalf of others, unless authorized by a resolution issued by the company's Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>.

## Article (8)

The capital owner shall be responsible for the following matters:
1. Amending the company's articles of association.
2. Dissolving and liquidating the company.
3. Merging, converting, or splitting the company.
4. Increasing or decreasing the company's capital.
5. Dismissing the company's manager, or restricting his authority.
Subject to the provisions of merger, conversion, and split stipulated in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 AD, as amended by Law No. 15 of 2017 AD, and its executive regulations, the aforementioned decisions shall be implemented by registering them in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> without the need for formal documentation.

### Company Accounts

## Article (9)

The company's fiscal year begins in January and ends in December each year, with the exception of the first fiscal year, which begins from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and ends on the specified date of the end of the following fiscal year.

### Dissolution and Liquidation of the Company

## Article (10)

The company shall also be dissolved – and insofar as it does not conflict with the nature of a one-person company – for one of the reasons stipulated in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 AD, as amended by Law No. 15 of 2017 AD, and its executive regulations.
The dissolution of the company must be publicized, and the dissolution of the company shall not be invoked against third parties except from the date of publication.
The company's manager must follow up on the implementation of this procedure.

## Article (11)

The company's assets shall be liquidated upon its dissolution for any reason, in accordance with the provisions contained in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 AD, as amended by Law No. 15 of 2017 AD, and its executive regulations.

## Article (12)

The owner shall be personally liable for the company's obligations in the following cases:
a) If he, in bad faith, liquidates it or ceases its activity before the expiry of its term, or before achieving the purpose for which it was established.
b) If he fails to separate his financial liability from the company's financial liability.
c) If he conducts business on behalf of the company before it acquires legal personality.

## Article (13)

All papers, contracts, publications, advertisements, and other documents issued by the company must bear its trade name, a statement of its legal form, its registration number in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>, a statement of the amount of its capital and the paid-up portion thereof, followed by the phrase One-Person Company (O.P.C.) <orig>شركة الشخص الواحد (ش.ش.و)</orig>.

## Article (14)

The company – in matters not mentioned in these articles – shall be subject to the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 AD, as amended by Law No. 15 of 2017 AD, and its executive regulations.

a request for the release of the company's bank guarantees deposited with the Municipality in consideration of its classification.
Based on Article (19) of Municipality Resolution No. (2009/161) regarding the classification, licensing, and registration of building and demolition contractors in Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, which stipulates that a contractor may submit a request to the Municipality to cancel their registration before its expiry or to cancel the classification. The name of the submitting company or institution and the beneficiary entity, Abdullah Al-Salem University <orig>جامعة عبدالله السالم</orig>, must be entered. A national labor support certificate must be attached with the bids, otherwise, the bid will be considered void.
Note: Follow Abdullah Al-Salem University's <orig>جامعة عبدالله السالم</orig> website aasu.edu.kw for any updates regarding Tender (2026-2025/15).

Acquisition by the Public Investment Fund <orig>صندوق الاستثمارات العامة</orig> of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia (Kingdom of Saudi Arabia) of 54% of the shares of MBC Group <orig>مجموعة ام بي سي</orig> (Listed Joint Stock Company) (Kingdom of Saudi Arabia)
In accordance with Law No. (72) of 2020 concerning Competition Protection <orig>حماية المنافسة</orig> and Article (83) of its Executive Regulations issued by Board of Directors Resolution No. (14) of 2021, which stipulates that "any interested party may submit a reasoned objection to the Agency regarding the economic concentration request within (15) fifteen days from the date of notification or publication...".
Accordingly, the Agency invites all interested parties to submit their reasoned objections to this economic concentration within a period not exceeding fifteen days from the date of this announcement.
Objection data must be submitted at the headquarters of the Competition Protection Agency <orig>جهاز حماية المنافسة</orig>, Al Hamra Tower, 14th Floor, by filling out the form available on the website, along with paying the prescribed fee.

# Kuwait Fund for Arab Economic Development <orig>الصندوق الكويتي للتنمية الاقتصادية العربية</orig>
Announcement
Practice No. (2025/58)
Regarding the supply, installation, and warranty of (2) automatic filing cabinets for the Kuwait Fund for Economic Development <orig>الصندوق الكويتي للتنمية الاقتصادية</orig>.
The Kuwait Fund for Arab Economic Development <orig>الصندوق الكويتي للتنمية الاقتصادية العربية</orig> announces the tender for Practice No. (2025/58) regarding the supply, installation, and warranty of (2) automatic filing cabinets for the Kuwait Fund for Economic Development <orig>الصندوق الكويتي للتنمية الاقتصادية</orig>.
Companies and institutions specialized in this field wishing to participate in this practice should access the website of the Kuwait Fund for Arab Economic Development <orig>الصندوق الكويتي للتنمية الاقتصادية العربية</orig> (www.kuwait-fund.org) or the e-government website (www.e.gov.kw) for a non-refundable fee of (40 K.D.) forty Kuwaiti Dinars. The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Monday, 04/08/2025. Bids shall remain valid and cannot be withdrawn for a period of (90) ninety days from the date of opening the bid envelopes. The bidder must also deposit with their bid an initial security deposit of not less than 2% of the bid value, and this security must be valid and effective for the duration of the bid's validity.
Acting Director General

2. Submission of an authorization letter from the company in the name of the authorized person to submit the bid, along with a copy of the civil ID of the same authorized person and a signature authentication certificate.
3. The authorized representative of the company must place all tender documents and all required documents completely in the designated envelope according to the instructions contained in the documents and the tender announcement, and seal it with red wax. Then, he must personally and under his personal responsibility place the first envelope (bid submission envelope) in the designated box, which contains:
- The bid form and wording, and the total bid value (original copies), with complete data, stamped and signed.
- The preliminary bond in the name of the bidder in favor of the Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> in the form of a certified check or an unconditional, reservation-free, on-demand bank guarantee letter issued in Arabic by a bank accredited in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and valid throughout the bid validity period and for the value specified in the above announcement. The bidder is not entitled to cancel it, have it seized by creditors, or claim any interest on it. Cash bonds are not accepted. Bids that do not include the preliminary bond will be excluded.
- A valid national labor percentage compliance certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>. Bids that do not include this certificate will be excluded.

7. The Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> has the right to reject any bid that does not contain all required documents.

# Qualification Requirements

## Conditions for Participation in the Tender

### Financial Criteria

**Required Requirements / Documents**

Financial statements for the last three years containing the following:
- Statement of Financial Position (Balance Sheet)
- Statement of Profit or Loss and Statement of Comprehensive Income (Adjusted)
- Statement of Changes in Equity.
- Statement of Cash Flows.
- Notes to the Financial Statement.

**Conditions to be met:**
- Audited financial statements approved by an independent and accredited accounting audit firm.
- Must be in Arabic or English.
- Must bear the same name as the applicant.
- The independent auditor's report must be for general use.

Financial evaluation will be applied using approved ratios and equations to measure performance and identify the company's financial strengths and weaknesses, as shown in the table below (Appendix No. 1).

**Note:**
The company has passed the financial evaluation after correctly filling in the required data and obtaining 6 out of 15 points, following auditing and data review.

The bidder will be evaluated based on the following criteria:
1. Liquidity
2. Financial Leverage
3. Profitability
4. Activity

Please refer to Appendix No. (1) table "Financial Evaluation of Public Tenders" for details on calculating evaluation criteria.

### Bidder's personnel

The bidder must submit a list of personnel with supporting evidence in accordance with Appendix No. (2) as shown in the table.

### QA/QC

The bidder must submit Quality Assurance / Quality Control data with supporting evidence in accordance with Appendix No. (3) as shown.

### HSE

**Health and Safety Standards**

1. The bidder will be evaluated as specified in Appendix (2).
2. The total recordable cases rate will be calculated based on the following equation:
    TRC = (LY × 3) + [(LY1) × 2] + [(LY2) × 1]
    - (TRC): Total Recordable Cases
    - LY: Recordable Cases for the Last Year
    - LY1: Cases for the Year Before Last
    - LY2: Cases for Two Years Before Last
3. To pass the Health, Safety, and Environment (HSE) evaluation, a minimum of ten out of twenty points must be achieved.
4. The HSE organizational structure must include, but is not limited to, the following details: (Safety/Environment Engineer, Safety/Environment Supervisor, etc.)
5. The bidder must submit the "HSE Management System Questionnaire Form" with all questions answered. If even one question is left unanswered, no points will be awarded (Attachment 3).
6. Disqualification will occur if one of the following two requirements is not met:
    - A written document for the HSE Management System model (HSE Management System Questionnaire Form).
    - Assignment of the HSE Performance Details Form (based on Kuwait National Petroleum Company <orig>شركة البترول الوطنية الكويتية</orig> table, Attachment 4).
7. A valid copy of ISO 45001 certificate or ISO 14001 certificate.
8. Please refer to the attachments for HSE criteria / requirements, Appendix (4, 5, and 6).

### Special Criteria

**Years of Establishment**
The period of establishment must not be less than 3 years, and therefore, the

**Minimum Experience**

**Foreign Contractor:**
- The cumulative value of projects / contracts completed during the last ten years must be a minimum of KD 4,816,900, and the value of each accepted project / contract must not be less than KD 1,313,700.
- At least one completed project / contract outside the country of origin must be submitted.

**Local Contractor:**
- The cumulative value of projects / contracts completed during the last ten years must be a minimum of KD 3,941,100, and the value of each accepted project / contract must not be less than KD 1,313,700.
- Ongoing projects / contracts that have reached an actual completion rate of 75% may be considered in the cumulative value calculation, provided that:
    - A letter from the client proving good performance is submitted.
    - At least two completed projects / contracts are available for ongoing projects / contracts to be considered (with the same value condition mentioned above applied to each of the projects / contracts submitted from the ongoing project / contract).

**Scope of Submitted Projects**
All submitted projects / contracts must be in the fields of oil, gas, refining, or petrochemical projects.

### Scope of Work for Submitted Projects
- The scope of work for the required expertise / projects / contracts must be consistent with the complementary category of technical work.
- Projects / contracts must include, starting from the basic design phase, detailed design, procurement of necessary equipment and materials, construction, pre-commissioning, commissioning, performance testing, and handover of completed facilities to the relevant client.
- Detailed design and engineering works must have been 100% executed or executed under engineering management by the bidder.
- The value of purchase orders issued by the bidder for a project / contract considered under the mandatory section must exceed 40% of the project's contract value.

### Verification of Submitted Documents
- The bidder must submit the following documents for verification:
  Copies of projects / contracts / agreements showing the signature page, scope of work, value, start date and duration, completion certificate, and certificate issued by the client.
  Proof of execution of engineering activities (e.g., drawings / calculations ... etc.).
  For ongoing projects / contracts - a letter from the client indicating the performance level and completion percentage of the project / contract.
  Additional documents may be requested for verification, such as drawings, payment data, and records of equipment and facilities.

### Method of Document Submission:
- The tenderer must create a main file titled "PQ Criteria Documents". It should include all the aforementioned documents.
- The tenderer must submit all required documents in the main file, each file separately, and provide an appropriate title for each file to facilitate review. Use sub-folders within each.
